description: Lists information about your private certificate authority (CA) or one that has been shared with you. You specify the private CA on input by its ARN (Amazon Resource Name). The output contains the status of your CA. This can be any of the following:

parameters.name: CertificateAuthorityArn
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that was returned when you called CreateCertificateAuthority. This must be of the form: ``arn:aws:acm-pca:region:account:certificate-authority/12345678-1234-1234-1234-123456789012 ``.

nested_items.name: CertificateAuthority
nested_items.description: A CertificateAuthority structure that contains information about your private CA.

nested_items.name: Arn
nested_items.description: Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for your private certificate authority (CA). The format is ``12345678-1234-1234-1234-123456789012 ``.

nested_items.name: OwnerAccount
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services account ID that owns the certificate authority.

nested_items.name: CreatedAt
nested_items.description: Date and time at which your private CA was created.

nested_items.name: LastStateChangeAt
nested_items.description: Date and time at which your private CA was last updated.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: Type of your private CA.

nested_items.name: Serial
nested_items.description: Serial number of your private CA.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: Status of your private CA.

nested_items.name: NotBefore
nested_items.description: Date and time before which your private CA certificate is not valid.

nested_items.name: NotAfter
nested_items.description: Date and time after which your private CA certificate is not valid.

nested_items.name: FailureReason
nested_items.description: Reason the request to create your private CA failed.

nested_items.name: CertificateAuthorityConfiguration
nested_items.description: Your private CA configuration.

nested_items.name: KeyAlgorithm
nested_items.description: Type of the public key algorithm and size, in bits, of the key pair that your CA creates when it issues a certificate. When you create a subordinate CA, you must use a key algorithm supported by the parent CA.

nested_items.name: SigningAlgorithm
nested_items.description: Name of the algorithm your private CA uses to sign certificate requests.

nested_items.name: Country
nested_items.description: Two-digit code that specifies the country in which the certificate subject located.

nested_items.name: Organization
nested_items.description: Legal name of the organization with which the certificate subject is affiliated.

nested_items.name: OrganizationalUnit
nested_items.description: A subdivision or unit of the organization (such as sales or finance) with which the certificate subject is affiliated.

nested_items.name: DistinguishedNameQualifier
nested_items.description: Disambiguating information for the certificate subject.

nested_items.name: State
nested_items.description: State in which the subject of the certificate is located.

nested_items.name: CommonName
nested_items.description: For CA and end-entity certificates in a private PKI, the common name (CN) can be any string within the length limit.

nested_items.name: SerialNumber
nested_items.description: The certificate serial number.

nested_items.name: Locality
nested_items.description: The locality (such as a city or town) in which the certificate subject is located.

nested_items.name: Title
nested_items.description: A title such as Mr. or Ms., which is pre-pended to the name to refer formally to the certificate subject.

nested_items.name: Surname
nested_items.description: Family name. In the US and the UK, for example, the surname of an individual is ordered last. In Asian cultures the surname is typically ordered first.

nested_items.name: GivenName
nested_items.description: First name.

nested_items.name: Initials
nested_items.description: Concatenation that typically contains the first letter of the GivenName, the first letter of the middle name if one exists, and the first letter of the Surname.

nested_items.name: Pseudonym
nested_items.description: Typically a shortened version of a longer GivenName. For example, Jonathan is often shortened to John. Elizabeth is often shortened to Beth, Liz, or Eliza.

nested_items.name: GenerationQualifier
nested_items.description: Typically a qualifier appended to the name of an individual. Examples include Jr. for junior, Sr. for senior, and III for third.

nested_items.name: CustomAttributes
nested_items.description: Contains a sequence of one or more X.500 relative distinguished names (RDNs), each of which consists of an object identifier (OID) and a value. For more information, see NIST's definition of Object Identifier (OID).

nested_items.name: ObjectIdentifier
nested_items.description: Specifies the object identifier (OID) of the attribute type of the relative distinguished name (RDN).

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: Specifies the attribute value of relative distinguished name (RDN).

nested_items.name: CsrExtensions
nested_items.description: Specifies information to be added to the extension section of the certificate signing request (CSR).

nested_items.name: DigitalSignature
nested_items.description: Key can be used for digital signing.

nested_items.name: NonRepudiation
nested_items.description: Key can be used for non-repudiation.

nested_items.name: KeyEncipherment
nested_items.description: Key can be used to encipher data.

nested_items.name: DataEncipherment
nested_items.description: Key can be used to decipher data.

nested_items.name: KeyAgreement
nested_items.description: Key can be used in a key-agreement protocol.

nested_items.name: KeyCertSign
nested_items.description: Key can be used to sign certificates.

nested_items.name: CRLSign
nested_items.description: Key can be used to sign CRLs.

nested_items.name: EncipherOnly
nested_items.description: Key can be used only to encipher data.

nested_items.name: DecipherOnly
nested_items.description: Key can be used only to decipher data.

nested_items.name: SubjectInformationAccess
nested_items.description: For CA certificates, provides a path to additional information pertaining to the CA, such as revocation and policy. For more information, see Subject Information Access in RFC 5280.

nested_items.name: AccessMethod
nested_items.description: The type and format of AccessDescription information.

nested_items.name: CustomObjectIdentifier
nested_items.description: An object identifier (OID) specifying the AccessMethod. The OID must satisfy the regular expression shown below. For more information, see NIST's definition of Object Identifier (OID).

nested_items.name: AccessMethodType
nested_items.description: Specifies the AccessMethod.

nested_items.name: AccessLocation
nested_items.description: The location of AccessDescription information.

nested_items.name: OtherName
nested_items.description: Represents GeneralName using an OtherName object.

nested_items.name: TypeId
nested_items.description: Specifies an OID.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: Specifies an OID value.

nested_items.name: Rfc822Name
nested_items.description: Represents GeneralName as an RFC 822 email address.

nested_items.name: DnsName
nested_items.description: Represents GeneralName as a DNS name.

nested_items.name: DirectoryName
nested_items.description: Contains information about the certificate subject. The Subject field in the certificate identifies the entity that owns or controls the public key in the certificate. The entity can be a user, computer, device, or service. The ``Subject ``must contain an X.500 distinguished name (DN). A DN is a sequence of relative distinguished names (RDNs). The RDNs are separated by commas in the certificate.

nested_items.name: Country
nested_items.description: Two-digit code that specifies the country in which the certificate subject located.

nested_items.name: Organization
nested_items.description: Legal name of the organization with which the certificate subject is affiliated.

nested_items.name: OrganizationalUnit
nested_items.description: A subdivision or unit of the organization (such as sales or finance) with which the certificate subject is affiliated.

nested_items.name: DistinguishedNameQualifier
nested_items.description: Disambiguating information for the certificate subject.

nested_items.name: State
nested_items.description: State in which the subject of the certificate is located.

nested_items.name: CommonName
nested_items.description: For CA and end-entity certificates in a private PKI, the common name (CN) can be any string within the length limit.

nested_items.name: SerialNumber
nested_items.description: The certificate serial number.

nested_items.name: Locality
nested_items.description: The locality (such as a city or town) in which the certificate subject is located.

nested_items.name: Title
nested_items.description: A title such as Mr. or Ms., which is pre-pended to the name to refer formally to the certificate subject.

nested_items.name: Surname
nested_items.description: Family name. In the US and the UK, for example, the surname of an individual is ordered last. In Asian cultures the surname is typically ordered first.

nested_items.name: GivenName
nested_items.description: First name.

nested_items.name: Initials
nested_items.description: Concatenation that typically contains the first letter of the GivenName, the first letter of the middle name if one exists, and the first letter of the Surname.

nested_items.name: Pseudonym
nested_items.description: Typically a shortened version of a longer GivenName. For example, Jonathan is often shortened to John. Elizabeth is often shortened to Beth, Liz, or Eliza.

nested_items.name: GenerationQualifier
nested_items.description: Typically a qualifier appended to the name of an individual. Examples include Jr. for junior, Sr. for senior, and III for third.

nested_items.name: CustomAttributes
nested_items.description: Contains a sequence of one or more X.500 relative distinguished names (RDNs), each of which consists of an object identifier (OID) and a value. For more information, see NIST's definition of Object Identifier (OID).

nested_items.name: ObjectIdentifier
nested_items.description: Specifies the object identifier (OID) of the attribute type of the relative distinguished name (RDN).

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: Specifies the attribute value of relative distinguished name (RDN).

nested_items.name: EdiPartyName
nested_items.description: Represents GeneralName as an EdiPartyName object.

nested_items.name: PartyName
nested_items.description: Specifies the party name.

nested_items.name: NameAssigner
nested_items.description: Specifies the name assigner.

nested_items.name: UniformResourceIdentifier
nested_items.description: Represents GeneralName as a URI.

nested_items.name: IpAddress
nested_items.description: Represents GeneralName as an IPv4 or IPv6 address.

nested_items.name: RegisteredId
nested_items.description: Represents GeneralName as an object identifier (OID).

nested_items.name: RevocationConfiguration
nested_items.description: Information about the Online Certificate Status Protocol (OCSP) configuration or certificate revocation list (CRL) created and maintained by your private CA.

nested_items.name: CrlConfiguration
nested_items.description: Configuration of the certificate revocation list (CRL), if any, maintained by your private CA. A CRL is typically updated approximately 30 minutes after a certificate is revoked. If for any reason a CRL update fails, Amazon Web Services Private CA makes further attempts every 15 minutes.

nested_items.name: Enabled
nested_items.description: Boolean value that specifies whether certificate revocation lists (CRLs) are enabled. You can use this value to enable certificate revocation for a new CA when you call the CreateCertificateAuthority action or for an existing CA when you call the UpdateCertificateAuthority action.

nested_items.name: ExpirationInDays
nested_items.description: Validity period of the CRL in days.

nested_items.name: CustomCname
nested_items.description: Name inserted into the certificate CRL Distribution Points extension that enables the use of an alias for the CRL distribution point. Use this value if you don't want the name of your S3 bucket to be public.

nested_items.name: S3BucketName
nested_items.description: Name of the S3 bucket that contains the CRL. If you do not provide a value for the CustomCname argument, the name of your S3 bucket is placed into the CRL Distribution Points extension of the issued certificate. You can change the name of your bucket by calling the UpdateCertificateAuthority operation. You must specify a bucket policy that allows Amazon Web Services Private CA to write the CRL to your bucket.

nested_items.name: S3ObjectAcl
nested_items.description: Determines whether the CRL will be publicly readable or privately held in the CRL Amazon S3 bucket. If you choose PUBLIC_READ, the CRL will be accessible over the public internet. If you choose BUCKET_OWNER_FULL_CONTROL, only the owner of the CRL S3 bucket can access the CRL, and your PKI clients may need an alternative method of access.

nested_items.name: CrlDistributionPointExtensionConfiguration
nested_items.description: Configures the behavior of the CRL Distribution Point extension for certificates issued by your certificate authority. If this field is not provided, then the CRl Distribution Point Extension will be present and contain the default CRL URL.

nested_items.name: OmitExtension
nested_items.description: Configures whether the CRL Distribution Point extension should be populated with the default URL to the CRL. If set to true, then the CDP extension will not be present in any certificates issued by that CA unless otherwise specified through CSR or API passthrough.

nested_items.name: CrlType
nested_items.description: Specifies whether to create a complete or partitioned CRL. This setting determines the maximum number of certificates that the certificate authority can issue and revoke. For more information, see Amazon Web Services Private CA quotas.

COMPLETE - The default setting. Amazon Web Services Private CA maintains a single CRL ï¬le for all unexpired certiï¬cates issued by a CA that have been revoked for any reason. Each certiï¬cate that Amazon Web Services Private CA issues is bound to a speciï¬c CRL through its CRL distribution point (CDP) extension, deï¬ned in RFC 5280.
PARTITIONED - Compared to complete CRLs, partitioned CRLs dramatically increase the number of certiï¬cates your private CA can issue.

nested_items.name: CustomPath
nested_items.description: Designates a custom ï¬le path in S3 for CRL(s). For example, http://<CustomName>/ <CustomPath>/<CrlPartition_GUID>.crl.

nested_items.name: OcspConfiguration
nested_items.description: Configuration of Online Certificate Status Protocol (OCSP) support, if any, maintained by your private CA. When you revoke a certificate, OCSP responses may take up to 60 minutes to reflect the new status.

nested_items.name: Enabled
nested_items.description: Flag enabling use of the Online Certificate Status Protocol (OCSP) for validating certificate revocation status.

nested_items.name: OcspCustomCname
nested_items.description: By default, Amazon Web Services Private CA injects an Amazon Web Services domain into certificates being validated by the Online Certificate Status Protocol (OCSP). A customer can alternatively use this object to define a CNAME specifying a customized OCSP domain.

nested_items.name: RestorableUntil
nested_items.description: The period during which a deleted CA can be restored. For more information, see the PermanentDeletionTimeInDays parameter of the DeleteCertificateAuthorityRequest action.

nested_items.name: KeyStorageSecurityStandard
nested_items.description: Defines a cryptographic key management compliance standard used for handling CA keys.

nested_items.name: UsageMode
nested_items.description: Specifies whether the CA issues general-purpose certificates that typically require a revocation mechanism, or short-lived certificates that may optionally omit revocation because they expire quickly. Short-lived certificate validity is limited to seven days.
